alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 11:06PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, northeastern Knox and central Clay Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1106 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Deer Lick, or 8 miles east of London, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lake, Sasser, Blackwater, Grace and Gibbs around 1110 PM EDT. Hooker, Bush, Urban, Sidell, Tedders and Sprule around 1115 PM EDT. Pigeonroost, Sibert, Herron, Hima, Jonsee, Cottongin, Woollum and Haven around 1120 PM EDT. Manchester, Bluehole, House, Horse Creek Junction, Park Valley and Littleton around 1125 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Goose Rock, Boho, Botto, Plank, Lipps, Hector, Ogle, Brightshade, Peabody and Ice Cliff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
